pages.text: The $(item)Power Crucible$() is the $(thing)Essential Tool of Alchemy$(). Its unique capability to convert matter into its raw $(thing)Alchemical Power$() enables easy access to these powers.$(br2)Additionally, it acts as an ideal medium for $(thing)Transmutations$(0).$(p)To make one, you must first inscribe the symbol of

Using $(item)the Crucible$() is simple. The $(item)Device$() must be placed $(thing)In-World$(). Then, the $(item)Device$() may be filled with Water by hand. Due to the Warded Nature of its sides, $(thing)Automated Piping$() regrettably cannot access its interiors.$(br2)$(o)You can empty it with a shift right click.

When Items that bear $(thing)Power$() are added to the $(item)Crucible$(), their $(thing)Power$() is extracted. Usually, this leads to the $(thing)Existential Collapse$() of the item in question, but in certain cases a byproduct is created. $(br2)The presence of $(thing)Power$() in the $(item)Crucible$() can be noted by the tone of the water inside if there is enough. If Particles begin to escape or surround the crucible, this is evidence of a $(thing)Reaction$() taking place!
$(o)The process of creating the Crucible follows:
$(o)Transcribe the following, using glowing ink mixed with redstone, onto a clean paper. A simple crafting operation will suffice.$(br2)Then, simply apply the result to a Cauldron.
$(o)Do not fear: the risk of damaging or losing this journal in the process is slim to none.

$(o)The meaning of the glyphs is not important. Know only that the scroll's power is not derived from its writing, but in equal parts from the intrinsic properties of the ink, and from you. By taking the effort to transcribe these words, you bring about everything that will happen from now on.

$(1)For the engineering-oriented: $(p)$(item)Dispensers$(1) are able to both fill and empty $(l:reactive:objects_of_study/bottles)bottles of Power$(/l) when aimed at a Crucible. $(p)A $(item)Hopper$(1) is able to autonomously add items to the Crucible, even from the sides. $(p)Finally, output items bounce out of the Crucible high enough that a stream of Water would be able to catch them.
